item.description:
Patriots' Day and the Boston Marathon call for a trek across the entire Freedom Trail from the Massachusetts State House on Beacon Hill to the U.S.S. Constitution at the Charlestown Navy Yard.

Our 2.62 mile course will begin with an easy downhill and an introduction to the stars of the show (many of whom will be resting out this year's marathon in the comfort of the Granary Burying Ground), and seeing the sites where they went to school, where they protested, and where they drank.

Crossing the Greenway will bring you to the second portion of the course, through a labyrinth of small neighborhood streets, where you'll hear the story of a man who hung a couple of lanterns and another who rode a horse.

Crossing the Charles marks the the final leg of the course, and you'll see where Boston began. It includes the climb of a hill, where your heart may break upon hearing the story of General Warren's death.

The finish line is adorned with flags (and some cannons), and you will be able to tell your friends you completed the course in about 3 hours.

Get patriotic, lace up your running shoes, and come out for the Footloose on the Freedom Trail walking tour. ($20 per person/$5 for Boston By Foot card holders -- see web site).
item.how_to_find_us: Look for guides with Boston By Foot signs and buttons.
item.name: Patriots' Day Weekend Pre-Marathon Warmup on the Freedom Trail
